conversation.content: Hello, I'm Dr. Lee. Today I'll be conducting an assessment using the DSM-5 Self-Rated Level 1 Cross-Cutting Symptom Measure for adults. This will help us understand your current mental health experiences over the past two weeks. All your responses are confidential. I'll ask 23 questions one at a time - just describe how much each issue has bothered you. Ready when you are.
Okay, I guess. Let's get this over with then.
How much have you been bothered by little interest or pleasure in doing things during the past two weeks?
Honestly, I still enjoy some things. Maybe less when I'm feeling stressed, but not really. I go out with friends sometimes.
How much have you been bothered by feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?
I'm okay. I don't think I'm depressed. Just stressed, maybe. I mean, life's been tough, but I'm managing.
How much have you been bothered by feeling more irritated, grouchy, or angry than usual?
I guess I snap at people sometimes. Not like a big deal though. Everyone gets frustrated occasionally.
How much have you been bothered by sleeping less than usual, but still having a lot of energy?
I've had some nights where I don't sleep much, but I don't feel tired. Maybe I stay up partying or scrolling, but I'm fine during the day.
How much have you been bothered by starting lots more projects or risky things than usual?
I've taken some risks, yeah. Maybe drove home after drinking once. But it's not a habit, I swear.
How much have you been bothered by feeling nervous, anxious, worried, or on edge?
Anxious? Sometimes, sure. Mostly when I can't get to sleep. But I handle it by... well, you know.
How much have you been bothered by feeling panic or being frightened?
Not really. Maybe a panic attack a month ago? I don't want to dwell on it.
How much have you been bothered by avoiding situations that make you anxious?
Avoid places? No, I just... maybe stay home sometimes. Doesn't mean I'm avoiding.
How much have you been bothered by unexplained aches and pains?
My back's been sore lately. Doctor said it's stress. I've tried to ignore it.
How much have you been bothered by feeling your illnesses aren't taken seriously?
Not really. My doctor listens. Maybe I just worry too much.
How much have you been bothered by thoughts of actually hurting yourself?
No, I wouldn't do that. I'm just... upset about my choices sometimes.
How much have you been bothered by hearing things others couldn't hear, like voices when no one is around?
No, nothing like that. Maybe after too much alcohol I hear static? But that's normal?
How much have you been bothered by feeling someone could hear your thoughts or you can hear others' thoughts?
No, that's not right. I'm not crazy. I just feel... watched sometimes.
How much have you been bothered by problems with sleep affecting your sleep quality?
I can't sleep well. I lie awake for hours. Sometimes I drink to fall asleep, but that's not great.
How much have you been bothered by problems with memory or finding your way home?
I've forgotten where I was going a couple times. Once drove past my house, but that's rare.
How much have you been bothered by unpleasant thoughts or urges repeatedly entering your mind?
I overthink things sometimes. Like, after using, I regret it but can't stop. It loops in my head.
How much have you been bothered by feeling driven to perform certain behaviors or mental acts over and over?
Not really. I just... sometimes do things to take the edge off. You know, coping.
How much have you been bothered by feeling detached from yourself, your body, surroundings, or memories?
